speaker: Ledger
lines: Dust floats up to read with you, each mote a small, attentive eye.
You speak the names. The vault breathes, then remembers how to sigh.
Salt lines rewrite themselves into tidier letters.
The copper portraits look away, grateful to be relieved of their watch.
In the ledger's gutter lies a charm stitched of thread and phalange.
Your voice returns to you cleaner than it left.
The veil in the corner stops quivering. Silence keeps it still.
The ring on the floor cools. It is only gold again.

give_item.name: Bone Charm
give_item.description: A charm that makes names behave
